that looks like a regression:
```
-- Check for working C compiler: /Users/davydden/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-8.0.0-apple/openmpi-2.0.1-zgppod67vns7ojjqtw3qqwfid64jcclg/bin/mpicc -- broken
CMake Error at /Users/davydden/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-8.0.0-apple/cmake-3.6.1-jdgman4gzoaoidk22mgcdraxwudbbgj5/share/cmake-3.6/Modules/CMakeTestCCompiler.cmake:61 (message):
  The C compiler
  "/Users/davydden/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-8.0.0-apple/openmpi-2.0.1-zgppod67vns7ojjqtw3qqwfid64jcclg/bin/mpicc"
  is not able to compile a simple test program.
...
Spack compiler must be run from Spack! Input 'SPACK_PREFIX' is missing.
```

It certainly did not behave like that a month or so ago and one was able to build with Spack build MPI.
title: OpenMPI compiler can't be used outside of Spack on macOS with Clang
